title: Strengthen Cyber Security Controls
description: This involves implementing or improving technical measures to protect your systems and data. Key areas include:
actions: Access Control: Ensure that users only have access to the information and systems necessary for their roles. Implement strong password policies and consider multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Firewalls and Network Security: Use firewalls to control network traffic and segment your network to isolate critical systems.
Endpoint Protection: Install and maintain anti-malware software on all computers and servers.
Patch Management: Regularly update all software, including operating systems and applications, to protect against known vulnerabilities.

title: Develop or Obtain Basic Cyber Hygiene and Assessment Tools
description: Good cyber hygiene is the foundation of a strong security posture. This includes:
actions: Regular Backups: Create regular backups of important data and test your ability to restore from them.
Security Awareness Training: Educate employees about common threats like phishing and how to recognize and report them.
Vulnerability Scanning: Use tools to scan your systems for vulnerabilities and address them promptly.

title: Obtain Cyber Insurance
description: Cyber insurance can help mitigate the financial impact of a cyber attack. It can cover costs related to:
summary: Consult with a qualified insurance broker to understand the options and find a policy that fits your needs.

title: Work Towards Cyber Essentials Certification
description: Cyber Essentials is a UK government-backed scheme that helps you to protect your organization against a whole range of the most common cyber attacks. It demonstrates that you have key technical controls in place and can give you a competitive advantage. Many certifications also come with free cyber insurance.
